definition.name: NXmicrostructure_score_config

symbol.name: n_dg_ori
symbol.doc: Number of Bunge-Euler angle triplets for deformed grains.

symbol.name: n_rx_ori
symbol.doc: Number of Bunge-Euler angle triplets for recrystallization nuclei.

symbol.name: n_ori
symbol.doc: Number of texture components to analyze.

symbol.name: n_drag
symbol.doc: Number of support points for the linearized drag profile.

symbol.name: n_temp
symbol.doc: Number of support points for the desired time-temperature profile.

symbol.name: n_defrag
symbol.doc: Number of entries when to defragment i.e. garbage collect the memory holding state information for recrystallized cells.

symbol.name: n_snapshot
symbol.doc: Number of entries when to collect snapshots of the evolving microstructure.

symbol.name: n_su
symbol.doc: Number of solitary unit domains to export.

definition.doc:
Application definition to configure a simulation with the SCORE model.
* `M. Kühbach et al. <https://doi.org/10.1016/j.actamat.2016.01.068>`_ * `M. Diehl et al. <https://doi.org/10.1088/1361-651X/ab51bd>`_

field.name: identifier_simulation
field.doc: An alias to refer to this simulation.

field.name: description
field.doc: Discouraged free-text field to add further details to the computation.

field.name: start_time
field.doc: ISO 8601 time code with local time zone offset to UTC information included when the configuration file was created.

field.name: dimensionality
field.doc: Dimensionality of the simulation.

field.name: is_simulation
field.doc: A qualifier whether the sample is a real one or a virtual one.

field.name: atom_types
field.doc:
List of comma-separated elements from the periodic table that are contained in the specimen. If the specimen substance has multiple components, all elements from each component must be included in `atom_types`.
The purpose of the field is to offer research data management systems an opportunity to parse the relevant elements without having to interpret these from other sources.

group.name: program1
group.doc: Name of the program whereby this config file was created.

group.name: environment
group.doc: Programs and libraries representing the computational environment

group.name: material
group.doc: (Mechanical) properties of the material which scale the amount of stored (elastic) energy in the system and thus mainly affect recrystallization kinetics.

field.name: shear_modulus
field.doc: Reference shear modulus at zero Kelvin.

field.name: burgers_vector
field.doc: Magnitude of the Burgers vector at zero Kelvin.

field.name: melting_temperature
field.doc: Melting temperature

group.name: deformation
group.doc: Details about the geometry and properties of the polycrystal that represents the starting configuration (typically a deformed microstructure) for the simulation.

field.name: model
field.doc:
Which model should be used to generate a starting microstructure.
* cuboidal, a regular array of equally-shaped cuboidal grains * poisson_voronoi, a discretized Poisson Voronoi tessellation * ebsd, a microstructure synthesized based on a simulated or a measured EBSD orientation map * damask, the result of a simulation from `DAMASK <https://damask-multiphysics.org>`_.

field.name: extent
field.doc: Extent of each deformed grain in voxel along the x, y, and z direction when model is cuboidal.

field.name: diameter
field.doc: Average spherical diameter when model is poisson_voronoi.

group.name: ensemble
group.doc: Settings for instantiating properties of deformed grains when model is cuboidal or poisson.

field.name: bunge_euler
field.doc: Set of Bunge-Euler orientations (:math:`\varphi_1`, :math:`\Phi`, :math:`\varphi_2` ) out of which the orientations of deformed grains are sampled.

field.name: stored_energy
field.doc: Set of stored elastic energy quantified as a dislocation density which is assigned to deformed grains with orientations from bunge_euler with index queries matching for the bunge_euler and stored_energy fields.

group.name: ebsd
group.doc: Settings for instantiating properties of deformed grains from an EBSD orientation map when model is cuboidal or poisson.

field.name: stepsize
field.doc: Extent of the pixel of the EBSD orientation mapping assuming square-shaped pixels or cube-shaped voxels respectively.

group.name: damask
group.doc: Settings for instantiating properties of deformed grains and nuclei when model is damask.

field.name: file_name
field.doc: Name of the DREAM.3D HDF5 file that was instantiated from the a previously performed DAMASK simulation.

group.name: nucleation
group.doc: Phenomenological model according to which recrystallization nuclei are placed into the domain. Studying the growth of these nuclei is the main purpose of a SCORE simulation.

field.name: spatial_distribution
field.doc:
According to which model will the nuclei become distributed spatially:
* csr, complete spatial randomness * custom, implementation-specific * gb, nuclei placed at grain boundaries

field.name: incubation_time
field.doc:
According to which model will the nuclei start to grow:
* site_saturation, instantaneously

field.name: orientation
field.doc:
According to which model will the nuclei get their orientation assigned:
* ensemble, picking randomly one from ensemble/bunge_euler * random, picking randomly on the SO3 * damask, picking based on information provided in deformation/damask

group.name: ensemble
group.doc: Settings for instantiating properties of nuclei for recrystallizing grains.

field.name: bunge_euler
field.doc: Set of Bunge-Euler orientations (:math:`\varphi_1`, :math:`\Phi`, :math:`\varphi_2` ) out of which the orientations of nuclei/recrystallized grains are sampled.

field.name: incubation_time
field.doc: Incubation time which is assigned to deformed grains with orientations from bunge_euler with index queries matching for the bunge_euler and stored_energy fields.

group.name: grain_boundary_mobility
group.doc: Model for the assumed mobility of grain boundaries with different disorientation implemented as a parameterized Turnbull's model for thermally-activated grain boundary migration.

field.name: model
field.doc:
Which type of fundamental model for the grain boundary mobility.
Grain boundaries with disorientation angle smaller than 15 degree are considered as low-angle grain boundaries. Other grain boundaries are high-angle boundaries.

group.name: sebald_gottstein
group.doc: Parameter of the Sebald-Gottstein migration model.

field.name: lagb_pre_factor
field.doc: Pre-exponential factor for low-angle grain boundaries.

field.name: lagb_enthalpy
field.doc: Migration activation enthalpy for low-angle grain boundaries.

field.name: hagb_pre_factor
field.doc: Pre-exponential factor for high-angle grain boundaries.

field.name: hagb_enthalpy
field.doc: Migration activation enthalpy for high-angle grain boundaries.

field.name: special_pre_factor
field.doc: Pre-exponential factor for high-angle grain boundaries which in bicrystal or other tailored experiments showed a particular high mobility.

field.name: special_enthalpy
field.doc: Migration activation enthalpy for high-angle grain boundaries which in bicrystal or other tailored experiments showed a particular high mobility.

group.name: rollett_holm
group.doc: Parameter of the Rollett-Holm migration model.

field.name: pre_factor
field.doc: Pre-exponential factor for the fastest grain boundary in the system.

field.name: enthalpy
field.doc: Migration activation enthalpy for the fastest grain boundary in the system.

field.name: c1
field.doc: Mobility scaling factor :math:`c_1`. Typically 0.99 or higher but not 1.

field.name: c2
field.doc: Mobility scaling factor :math:`c_2`. Typically 5.

field.name: c3
field.doc: Mobility scaling factor :math:`c_3`. Typically 9.

group.name: stored_energy_recovery
group.doc: Time-dependent reduction of the stored energy to account for recovery effects.

field.name: model
field.doc: Which type of recovery model.

group.name: dispersoid_drag
group.doc: Reduction of the grain boundary migration speed due to the presence of dispersoids through which the total grain boundary area of the recrystallization front can be reduced while the boundary is arrested at the dispersoids.

field.name: model
field.doc: Which type of drag model.

group.name: zener_smith
group.doc: Parameter of the Zener-Smith drag model when model is zener_smith.

field.name: pre_factor
field.doc: Configuration-dependent constant which factorizes the drag pressure.

field.name: surface_energy
field.doc: Average surface energy of the grain-boundary-dispersoid-surface configuration which factorizes the drag pressure.

group.name: radius_evolution
group.doc: Assumed dispersoid mean radius-time profile

field.name: time
field.doc: Support point of the linearized curve of simulated time matching a specific support point of the average dispersoid radius.

field.name: radius
field.doc: Support point of the linearized curve of the average dispersoid radius.

field.name: name
field.doc: Given name of a texture component.

field.name: bunge_euler
field.doc: Bunge-Euler angle representation :math:`\varphi_1`, :math:`\Phi`, :math:`\varphi_2` of the of texture components in sequence of the name field.

field.name: theta
field.doc: Integration radius that constraints the theta angular region of the orientation space (SO3) about each central location (obeying symmetries) as specified by bunge_euler indexed in the same sequence as the bunge_euler and name fields.

group.name: time_temperature
group.doc: Desired simulated time-temperature profile

field.name: time
field.doc: Support point of the linearized curve of simulated time matching a specific support point of the temperature.

field.name: temperature
field.doc: Support point of the linearized curve of the temperature.

group.name: discretization
group.doc: Relevant data to instantiate a starting configuration that is typically a microstructure in deformed conditions where (elastic) energy is stored in the form of crystal defects (mostly dislocations). The SCORE model does not resolve individual dislocations but works with one homogenized mean-field density per grain. For simulations that are instantiated from EBSD datasets or crystal plasticity simulations individual values are available for each voxel that may be used as is for each voxel or may need a pre-processing of the data to coarse-grain material point-specific values to values averaged per deformed grain.

field.name: extent
field.doc: Extend of each CA domain in voxel along the x, y, and z direction. Deformation of sheet material is assumed. The x axis is assumed pointing along the rolling direction. The y axis is assumed pointing along the transverse direction. The z axis is assumed pointing along the normal direction.

field.name: cell_dimensions
field.doc: Edge length of the material point that in SCORE is discretized via equisized cubic voxels.

group.name: numerics
group.doc: Criteria which enable to stop the simulation in a controlled manner and assure a stable numerical integration. Whichever criterion is fulfilled first stops the simulation.

field.name: max_x
field.doc: Maximum recrystallized volume fraction.

field.name: max_time
field.doc: Maximum simulated physical time.

field.name: max_iteration
field.doc: Maximum number of iteration steps.

field.name: max_delta_x
field.doc: Maximum fraction equivalent to the migration of the fastest grain boundary in the system how much a cell may be consumed in a single iteration.

field.name: x_set
field.doc:
List of target values at which recrystallized volume fractions the state of the CA is evaluated and stored. The code documents summary statistics like recrystallized volume fraction for each iteration and the volume of each grain. Furthermore, snapshots of the microstructure are stored. These can take much disk space though because SCORE is able to evolve CA with up to :math:`1600^3` cells. Snapshot data document the current microstructure including the assignment of grains and cells surplus the state of the recrystallization front.
Despite these, data about the cells that define the recrystallization front make up for approximately one order of magnitude less cells than present in the domain. For the cells in this front, though, more data have to be collected than just a grain identifier.

group.name: cell_cache
group.doc: Parameter which control the memory management of cells in the recrystallization front.

field.name: initial
field.doc: Fraction of the total number of cells in the CA which should initially be allocated for offering storage for cells making up the recrystallization front.

field.name: realloc
field.doc: By how much more times should the already allocated memory be increased to offer space for storing states of cells in the recrystallization front.

field.name: defragment
field.doc: Should the cache for cells in the recrystallization front be defragmented on-the-fly or not.

field.name: defragment_x
field.doc: Target values at which recrystallized volume fraction the cache for cells in the recrystallization front will be defragmented on-the-fly. Defragmentation packs active cells closer into main memory to reduce cache misses in subsequent evaluations of the recrystallization front.

field.name: apply
field.doc: Perform a statistical analyses of the results as it was proposed by M. Kühbach (solitary unit model ensemble approach).

field.name: number_of_domains
field.doc: How many independent cellular automaton domains should be instantiated.

field.name: rediscretization
field.doc: Into how many time steps should the real time interval be discretized upon during post-processing the results with the solitary unit modeling approach.
